name: Juvenile Recurrent Parotitis
chief_complaint: My cheek keeps swelling and hurts when I eat
prognosis: Generally good with spontaneous resolution by adolescence, though recurrences are common during childhood
description: A non-obstructive, non-suppurative inflammatory condition of the parotid gland characterized by recurrent episodes of swelling and pain. Most common in children aged 3-6 years, with episodes lasting 3-7 days. Etiology is unclear but may involve ductal abnormalities or autoimmune factors.
